name: 英文（二）
goals: To introduce students to readings on a wide variety of themes
To teach students how to think critically about the issues addressed in the readings
To discuss, in English, the issues addressed in the readings
To help students become familiar with new vocabulary and culture points and discuss how they are used in the readings
To prepare students to be able to paraphrase passages from the readings and answer essay questions related to the readings
syllabus:
The course, Freshman English for English majors, has several goals:

1.  To introduce students to reading skills students need to employ when reading or discussing materials written in English.
2.  To teach students to think critically about issues addressed in materials written in English.
3.  To provide students with the opportunity to discuss thoughts and ideas generated by materials written in English.
4.  To prepare students to be able to paraphrase passages, write summaries, and answer essay questions.
5.  To provide students with the opportunity to read essays and other texts which provide greater exposure and deeper understanding of topics of global interest.
